title: Understanding Entropy
text: Entropy is a measure of randomness or disorder within a system. When a system's disorder increases, so does the entropy. Conversely, when a system becomes more ordered, the entropy decreases.

title: Effect of Compression
text: Consider what happens when you compress a gas at constant temperature. Are the gas particles more or less free to move? How does this affect the system's entropy?

title: Behavior of Gas Particles
text: When a gas is compressed, the particles have less space to move around. This restriction decreases the randomness of their positions, leading to a decrease in entropy.
